definition:
*Speedup* is a way to quantify the advantage of using a parallel
algorithm over a sequential algorithm. The speedup $S$ is defined as

$$S = \frac{R}{P}$$ Where $R$ is the running time of the best available
sequential algorithm and $P$ is the running time of the parallel
algorithm.

Ideally, on a system with $N$ processors, the speedup for any algorithm
would be $N$. Amdahl’s law deals with the speedup in more realistic
situations.
